hill_climbing module

class hill_climbing.HillClimbing(conflicts_checker, blocks, rooms, days, name_to_event_ids, output_filename='output/output.txt')[source]

Bases: object

Implements the Hill Climbing algorithm for timetable optimization. It iteratively improves a given timetable solution using various neighborhood moves.

curriculum_compactness_move(timetable, unscheduled_events)[source]

Tries to move isolated curriculum events closer to others to improve compactness.

evaluate_timetable(simulated_events)[source]

Evaluates a timetable based on soft constraint penalties, since there are no hard constraint violations.

Parameters:

simulated_events (dict) – The timetable being evaluated.

Returns:

Negative of total soft penalties if it’s better than the current best;

None if not an improvement.

Return type:

int or None

event_move(timetable, unscheduled_events)[source]

Performs a comprehensive move by reassigning an event to a new room and period, and potentially swapping with another event to resolve conflicts.

min_working_days_move(timetable, unscheduled_events)[source]

Increases the number of working days a course is scheduled on.

period_move(timetable, unscheduled_events)[source]

Attempts to move a random event to a different period (WeekDay,Timeslot).

revert_changes(timetable)[source]

Reverts any changes made to events based on saved original states.

room_move(timetable, unscheduled_events)[source]

Attempts to move a random event to a different available room.

room_stability_move(timetable, unscheduled_events)[source]

Tries to assign all lectures of a course to a single room to improve room stability.

run_hill_climbing(best_timetable, start_key, best_result_soft, start_time, time_limit)[source]

Executes the Hill Climbing algorithm using neighborhood moves until a local optimum is found.

Parameters:

  • best_timetable (dict) – Current best timetable solution.

  • start_key (int) – The event ID to start from.

  • best_result_soft (int) – Best known soft score.

  • start_time (float) – Start time (Unix timestamp).

  • time_limit (float) – Time limit in seconds.

Returns:

Final best soft score and corresponding timetable.

Return type:

Tuple[int, dict]

save_original_state(event)[source]

Stores the current state of an event before modification.
